Class PlayerStats

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.ui.PlayerStats
public class PlayerStats extends Object
Singleton class managing player statistics with persistence. Tracks cumulative gameplay data across sessions. Design Patterns Used: - Singleton Pattern: Ensures single instance manages all player stats - Persistence Pattern: Uses Java Preferences API for data persistence

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    getHighestCombo()
    Returns the highest number of lines cleared in a single combo.
    int
    getHighestLevel()
    Returns the highest level the player has reached in any game.
    int
    getHighestScore()
    Returns the highest score recorded in a single game.
    static PlayerStats
    getInstance()
    Returns the singleton instance of PlayerStats.
    int
    getTotalGamesPlayed()
    Returns the total number of games the player has played.
    long
    getTotalPointsScored()
    Returns the cumulative total of all points the player has scored.
    void
    recordCombo(int linesCleared)
    Records a combo event, updating the highest combo if the current combo (lines cleared) is greater than the previously recorded highest.
    void
    recordGameEnd(int finalScore, int finalLevel)
    Records the end of a game, updating total games played, total points scored, and potentially the highest score and highest level.
    void
    resetStats()
    Resets all player statistics to their initial values (0 or 1 for level) and persists these changes.

    Methods inherited from class Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static PlayerStats getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of PlayerStats. If the instance does not exist, it creates one.
      Returns:
      The single instance of PlayerStats.

    • recordGameEnd

      public void recordGameEnd(int finalScore, int finalLevel)
      Records the end of a game, updating total games played, total points scored, and potentially the highest score and highest level.
      Parameters:
      finalScore - The score achieved in the just-completed game.
      finalLevel - The level reached in the just-completed game.

    • recordCombo

      public void recordCombo(int linesCleared)
      Records a combo event, updating the highest combo if the current combo (lines cleared) is greater than the previously recorded highest.
      Parameters:
      linesCleared - The number of lines cleared in the current combo.

    • getTotalGamesPlayed

      public int getTotalGamesPlayed()
      Returns the total number of games the player has played.
      Returns:
      The total number of games played.

    • getTotalPointsScored

      public long getTotalPointsScored()
      Returns the cumulative total of all points the player has scored.
      Returns:
      The total points scored.

    • getHighestScore

      public int getHighestScore()
      Returns the highest score recorded in a single game.
      Returns:
      The highest score.

    • getHighestCombo

      public int getHighestCombo()
      Returns the highest number of lines cleared in a single combo.
      Returns:
      The highest combo.

    • getHighestLevel

      public int getHighestLevel()
      Returns the highest level the player has reached in any game.
      Returns:
      The highest level.

    • resetStats

      public void resetStats()
      Resets all player statistics to their initial values (0 or 1 for level) and persists these changes.
